cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northwest tonight, then turning north and making landfall along the south-central Louisiana coast before moving inland up the Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Intracoastal City–Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron; Tropical Storm Watch east of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City to Grand Isle; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas, and Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast, especially Louisiana and adjacent Mississippi coastline
weather_observation.wind: Fringe tropical-storm-force gusts are possible (probability peaks at 15% for 34-kt winds). Sustained gale-force winds are unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the upper Texas coast, but significant inundation (>3 ft) is not expected at Texas City.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional outer rainbands could drop 1–3 inches of rain; widespread 4-inch totals are not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls and isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands cannot be ruled out, but the risk is low at Texas City.
